examples: When I told you to ‘get lost’ I didn't expect to be taken literally.
Idioms usually cannot be translated literally into another language.

meanings.def: used to emphasize the truth of something that may seem surprising
examples: There are literally hundreds of prizes to win.

meanings.def: used to emphasize a word or phrase, even if it is not actually true in a literal sense
examples: I literally jumped out of my skin.
